intro: Actinoseris angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf sunspider or narrowleaf actinoseris, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant has a low-growing, mat-forming habit with hairy stems and narrow, linear leaves. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Actinoseris angustifolia is adapted to arid environments and is known for its ability to fix nitrogen through symbiotic relationships with root nodules.
